reporting_cycle: every three months; interim report by 12 August 2018; final report by 12 January 2019
summary:
The Security Council, 
Recalling previous resolutions and statements on Sudan, 
Determining the situation in Sudan continues to threaten international peace and security, 
Recalling the final report of the Sudan Panel of Experts, 
Acting under Chapter VII of the UN Charter, 

1. Recalls measures imposed by previous resolutions on Sudan, including arms embargo and travel bans; 
2. Extends the mandate of the Panel of Experts until 12 March 2019, reaffirms its mandate, and requests: 
- Interim report by 12 August 2018 
- Final report by 12 January 2019 
- Updates every three months to the Committee 
Intends to review the mandate by 12 February 2019; 
3. Intends to regularly review measures on Darfur, considering the evolving situation, 
previous Committee reports, and upcoming Panel of Experts reports; 
4. Decides to remain seized of the matter.
